description: Gets a description for one or more Network File System (NFS) file shares from an S3 File Gateway. This operation is only supported for S3 File Gateways.

parameters.name: FileShareARNList
parameters.description: An array containing the Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of each file share to be described. (string) --- The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the file share.

nested_items.name: NFSFileShareInfoList
nested_items.description: An array containing a description for each requested file share.

nested_items.name: NFSFileShareDefaults
nested_items.description: Describes Network File System (NFS) file share default values. Files and folders stored as Amazon S3 objects in S3 buckets don't, by default, have Unix file permissions assigned to them. Upon discovery in an S3 bucket by Storage Gateway, the S3 objects that represent files and folders are assigned these default Unix permissions. This operation is only supported for S3 File Gateways.

nested_items.name: FileMode
nested_items.description: The Unix file mode in the form 'nnnn'. For example, 0666 represents the default file mode inside the file share. The default value is 0666.

nested_items.name: DirectoryMode
nested_items.description: The Unix directory mode in the form 'nnnn'. For example, 0666 represents the default access mode for all directories inside the file share. The default value is 0777.

nested_items.name: GroupId
nested_items.description: The default group ID for the file share (unless the files have another group ID specified). The default value is nfsnobody.

nested_items.name: OwnerId
nested_items.description: The default owner ID for files in the file share (unless the files have another owner ID specified). The default value is nfsnobody.

nested_items.name: FileShareARN
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the file share.

nested_items.name: FileShareId
nested_items.description: The ID of the file share.

nested_items.name: FileShareStatus
nested_items.description: The status of the file share.

nested_items.name: GatewayARN
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the gateway. Use the  ListGateways operation to return a list of gateways for your account and Amazon Web Services Region.

nested_items.name: EncryptionType
nested_items.description: A value that specifies the type of server-side encryption that the file share will use for the data that it stores in Amazon S3.

nested_items.name: KMSEncrypted
nested_items.description: Optional. Set to true to use Amazon S3 server-side encryption with your own KMS key (SSE-KMS), or false to use a key managed by Amazon S3 (SSE-S3). To use dual-layer encryption (DSSE-KMS), set the EncryptionType parameter instead.

nested_items.name: KMSKey
nested_items.description: Optional. The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of a symmetric customer master key (CMK) used for Amazon S3 server-side encryption. Storage Gateway does not support asymmetric CMKs. This value must be set if KMSEncrypted is true, or if EncryptionType is SseKms or DsseKms.

nested_items.name: Path
nested_items.description: The file share path used by the NFS client to identify the mount point.

nested_items.name: Role
nested_items.description: The ARN of the IAM role that an S3 File Gateway assumes when it accesses the underlying storage.

nested_items.name: LocationARN
nested_items.description: A custom ARN for the backend storage used for storing data for file shares. It includes a resource ARN with an optional prefix concatenation. The prefix must end with a forward slash (/).

nested_items.name: DefaultStorageClass
nested_items.description: The default storage class for objects put into an Amazon S3 bucket by the S3 File Gateway. The default value is S3_STANDARD. Optional.

nested_items.name: ObjectACL
nested_items.description: A value that sets the access control list (ACL) permission for objects in the S3 bucket that an S3 File Gateway puts objects into. The default value is private.

nested_items.name: ClientList
nested_items.description: The list of clients that are allowed to access the S3 File Gateway. The list must contain either valid IPv4/IPv6 addresses or valid CIDR blocks.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: Squash
nested_items.description: The user mapped to anonymous user. Valid options are the following:
RootSquash: Only root is mapped to anonymous user.
NoSquash: No one is mapped to anonymous user.
AllSquash: Everyone is mapped to anonymous user.

nested_items.name: ReadOnly
nested_items.description: A value that sets the write status of a file share. Set this value to true to set the write status to read-only, otherwise set to false.

nested_items.name: GuessMIMETypeEnabled
nested_items.description: A value that enables guessing of the MIME type for uploaded objects based on file extensions. Set this value to true to enable MIME type guessing, otherwise set to false. The default value is true.

nested_items.name: RequesterPays
nested_items.description: A value that sets who pays the cost of the request and the cost associated with data download from the S3 bucket. If this value is set to true, the requester pays the costs; otherwise, the S3 bucket owner pays. However, the S3 bucket owner always pays the cost of storing data.

nested_items.name: Tags
nested_items.description: A list of up to 50 tags assigned to the NFS file share, sorted alphabetically by key name. Each tag is a key-value pair. For a gateway with more than 10 tags assigned, you can view all tags using the ListTagsForResource API operation.

nested_items.name: Key
nested_items.description: Tag key. The key can't start with aws:.

nested_items.name: Value
nested_items.description: Value of the tag key.

nested_items.name: FileShareName
nested_items.description: The name of the file share. Optional.

nested_items.name: CacheAttributes
nested_items.description: Refresh cache information for the file share.

nested_items.name: CacheStaleTimeoutInSeconds
nested_items.description: Refreshes a file share's cache by using Time To Live (TTL). TTL is the length of time since the last refresh after which access to the directory would cause the file gateway to first refresh that directory's contents from the Amazon S3 bucket or Amazon FSx file system. The TTL duration is in seconds.

nested_items.name: NotificationPolicy
nested_items.description: The notification policy of the file share. SettlingTimeInSeconds controls the number of seconds to wait after the last point in time a client wrote to a file before generating an ObjectUploaded notification. Because clients can make many small writes to files, it's best to set this parameter for as long as possible to avoid generating multiple notifications for the same file in a small time period.

nested_items.name: VPCEndpointDNSName
nested_items.description: Specifies the DNS name for the VPC endpoint that the NFS file share uses to connect to Amazon S3.

nested_items.name: BucketRegion
nested_items.description: Specifies the Region of the S3 bucket where the NFS file share stores files.

nested_items.name: AuditDestinationARN
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the storage used for audit logs.
